column4: Hey guys. I'm trying to compile kazehakase from source and it doesn't get past ./configure
Anyone have problems compiling that john?
that's not an ubuntu issue
get support from the vendor
I apologize, thought I was in #linux
no problem
not iwconfig
is it a linux box
Well I am asking in a ubuntu channel, so :P
ok - your machine isn't in a domain unless you've conifgued nis or nis+ or ldap, you can use samba as a 3rd part tools to join windows domains which will be listed in your /etc/smb.conf file
I meant networking wise. Not a workgroup. as in my box's name is host, so: host.as.something.edu
it won't be part of a domain unless you put it in, or do you mean your ISP's domain
I mean my ISP (university's) domian
your domain is oakland.resnet.pitt.edu
Ok, but how can I figure that out without using IRC.
your machine can be a member of 100 domains, so it's up to the people who administrate their domains.
I kinda mean what would appear as my email from this box: rpj@TheFunk.*.*.*, and how do I figure that out from the command line
that will depend on the "FROM" address
it will also depend on the domain name the mail relay you are using is set to come from and the domain name your ip block is assigned to
Ok, how do I figure out the domain name my ip address is assigned to. That's what I should have asked in the first place.
nslookup your IP address or use an RIPE lookup on the interent
Ok, now what's really bad is I'm not sure how I can figure out my IP. iwconfig comes up blank. I had to jump through some fancy hoops to get networking to work at my uni
ifconfig
I'm an idiot. thanks
